name: barrier+ Strengthening and Moisturizing Triple Lipid-Peptide Refillable Cream with B-L3
about: What it is:A high-potency face cream powered by B-L3‚Ñ¢ that quickly improves barrier function to hydrate, boost radiance, and visibly plump and firm over time..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, and Combination.Skincare Concerns:Fine Lines and Wrinkles, Dryness, and Loss of Firmness and Elasticity.Formulation:Cream.Highlighted Ingredients:- 3.5% Patented* B-L3‚Ñ¢ Barrier Lipid Complex: Replenishes natural lipids to restore skin‚Äôs moisture barrier in as little as one hour..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:This rich moisturizer is powered by Skinfix‚Äôs breakthrough patented* B-L3‚Ñ¢ Complex that is shown to restore skin‚Äôs moisture barrier quickly for hydrated, radiant, and dewy skin. Over time, skin looks dramatically firmer, plumper, and healthier than before..Clinical Results:In clinical study based on a TEWL measurement with 32 subjects, results showed:
ingredients: -3.5% Patented* B-L3‚Ñ¢ Barrier Lipid Complex: Replenishes natural lipids to restore skin's moisture barrier in as little as one hour. .-3% Nutripeptide Blend: Formulated for sensitive skin to reduce visible redness..-5% Hydrating Glycerin: A powerful humectant that pulls moisture into skin for a hydrated, dewy finish. ..Water/Aqua/Eau, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Glycerin, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Vegetable Oil/Huile V√©g√©tale, Cetyl Lactate, Propanediol, Caprylyl Caprylate/Caprate, C12-16 Alcohols, Jojoba Oil/Macadamia Seed Oil Esters, Glyceryl Stearate Citrate, Palmitic Acid, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Ceramide EOP, Ceramide NP, Ceramide AP, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Extract, Dilinoleic Acid/Propanediol Copolymer, Squalene, Ophiopogon Japonicus Root Extract, Phytosteryl Sunflowerseedate, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Extract, Hydrolyzed Rice Protein, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Hydrogenated Vegetable Glycerides, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Extract, Phytosteryl Macadamiate, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Tocopherol, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Phytosterols, Sodium Lauroyl Lactylate, Gluconolactone, Acetyl Glutamine, Lecithin, Amylopectin, Bacillus/Soybean Ferment Extract, Phenethyl Alcohol, Sodium Benzoate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Folic Acid, Oligopeptide-1, Hexapeptide-11, Oligopeptide-3, Caprylyl Glycol, Oligopeptide-2, Lithothamnion Calcareum Extract, Lactic Acid, Phytosphingosine, Cholesterol, Carbomer, Pentylene Glycol, Potassium Sorbate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Citric Acid, Xanthan Gum, Tocopheryl Acetate, Phenoxyethanol...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Press for one to two pumps in the morning and at night..-Apply to clean, dry skin on the face and neck..-Appropriate for use with retinol, AHAs, BHAs, vitamin C, and most actives..-To fully realize clinical-grade skin-barrier benefits, use with the complete Skinfix Barrier+ regimen (sold separately)...Refill Pod:.-Unscrew lid from empty jar..-Open refill pod..-Remove foil seal..-Twist onto pump..-Ensure there is a tight seal between refill pod and pump..-If pod is difficult to connect, check that the piston (round plastic disc) is not stuck to the lid from your last empty cream jar..-Place refill in base jar, screw pump onto base, and prime for use..-Enjoy...Recycling Instructions:.-This is a refillable jar, so the best option is to keep the pump, cap, and outer jar and purchase the refill pod..-If you are disposing of the jar, remove the pump and cap and bring to a Pact Collective bin at Sephora..-Place the outer jar into the recycling bin..-Rinse the inner cup with soapy water and place in a recycling bin..-All of Skinfix's boxes are made from Forest Stewardship Counsel-certified, 100 percent recycled paper using vegetable-based inks. .-Place in a recycling bin.

reviews.review_title: The Cream Your Skin Will Thank You For
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Okay, so let me tell you about the Skinfix Barrier+ Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream because...WOW. My skin has been through it lately. Thanks to a hormonal acne phase (ugh), I‚Äôve been dealing with post-breakout discoloration, plus living in NYC where the weather can‚Äôt decide between hot or freezing, which has left my skin parched.  This cream is basically my skin‚Äôs BFF right now. It‚Äôs hydrating without feeling heavy, which was a major win when I took it to the Dominican Republic. I was worried it might be too much for the heat, but nope‚Äîfelt lightweight and soothing. Back in NYC it‚Äôs still killing it, keeping my skin moisturized even with the wild weather shifts.  The texture is dreamy‚Äîplush but not greasy‚Äîand the pump? Genius. No waste, no cross contamination, just perfection. I love that it layers like a pro with my actives. My skin feels plumper, smoother, and dare I say, glowier. Also, non-comedogenic for the win because we are NOT inviting acne back.  If your skin barrier needs a reboot, this is it. Clinically proven to work in 30 minutes?? Believe it, because my skin looks and feels healthier after just a few weeks. And hello, refillable pods?! Eco-conscious skincare is a big yes from me.  Skinfix just gets it. Whether you‚Äôre battling dryness, discoloration, or just want skin that looks like it‚Äôs living its best life‚Äîthis cream delivers üíß‚ú®

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Olive skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Was a bit confused at first about how to correctly open the product and I accidentally opened the bottom, but it fit back into place easily and I realized that it wasn't a screw off top, but a pop up lid. After opening the product correctly, I pumped a couple times, about 4, to get the product out. The amount of product dispensed is perfect for use and prevents me from using too much. Because the formula is thick and gel like, it really sits on the top layer of the skin and helps keep the skin hydrated. I use a lot of acne forward products like retin-a, retinol, salicylic acid, you name it I have probably used it, but of course it can be very drying to my skin. So I always have to a nourishing cream on hand. Of course, my skin being acneic I can't just use anything. For starters, I love the no mess pump of the cream because one full pump is more than plenty to use but also you don't waste any product. The first time trying the cream I used it after my retin-a which I loved because the cream lathers extremely deep and rich. And there is a longevity to the later which allows you to get a nice massage on your face to work in the cream as much as possible. My face felt wonderfully afterwards, but to my dismay the next morning I woke up with a few extra blemishes that I did not go to sleep with. The cream claims to be non-comedoginic, but I'm not sure if my face agreed with it.  I do plan to try at least one more time to rule out if the shea butter and jojoba oil is too much for me. However, if your skin is not acne prone I think it's a really nourishing cream!

My skin feels more resilient, and I haven‚Äôt experienced any of the usual dry patches or redness that used to pop up from time to time.  What stands out most is the barrier-repairing aspect. This cream doesn‚Äôt just hydrate‚Äîit helps to restore the skin‚Äôs natural protective barrier, which is key for me since I‚Äôm outdoors a lot. The formulation seems gentle but powerful, and it doesn‚Äôt irritate my skin like some other creams have in the past.  All in all, Skin Fix Barrier+ is a solid product that‚Äôs helped keep my skin healthy and balanced, especially in the colder months. It‚Äôs a bit on the pricier side, but given how well it works and the fact that a little goes a long way, I think it‚Äôs definitely worth the investment. reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I haven't tried the original version so I can't say how it was different from this new reformulation. No added fragrance or essential oils, so it smells just like generic lotion, not especially nice but not terrible (if it does tbh I'd guess it's gone rancid).  I have very dry, acne-prone skin. Unfortunately, it doesn't soak in very well when I use it on my face. When I first apply it, I can literally see everywhere it is on my skin because it just looks like I'm spreading a thin layer of white all over. It takes a while for it to soak in enough to not leave such a noticeable cast. Even after giving it that time though, it leaves me looking pretty shiny and greasy. Weirdly, it works great and doesn't have any sort of greasy cast on my neck and hands, so it might be that my face is just too dehydrated for this formula to absorb properly.  It stung slightly on application and I did feel like my face was a bit redder initially, but I started using tretinoin pretty recently so that is likely the reason, but something to be aware of if you have a damaged barrier or otherwise very dry skin.  It also reacts with certain other products when layering--on top of some of my serums,  it just dried in a thin mask on my skin--I literally could peel off the layer of moisturizer. On bare skin it doesn't do this at least, but still, the shine factor is a bit much.  It's moderately moisturizing, not hugely so, and I've tried other products that didn't have the greasiness, so I'll probably not stick with this product except to finish it up, but I think it would work well for someone with normal to only slightly dry skin that's sensitive to things like added fragrance.

reviews.review_text: I've been really enjoying this cream. Here's why!  Pros: - I have sensitive skin and it hasn't irritated it at all. - It is fragrance free and has no parabens or alcohol. - It's a well-aging product that can be used by people like me who don't use retinoids (though you can also use it with retinoids). - It layers well with other products and sinks into the skin fine. - It provides a good occlusive barrier to seal in any products I apply beforehand. - Restores skin's natural lips and prevents TEWL (trans epidermal water loss), so it's good for dry skin. - It has clean ingredients that are also active (I'd call it cleanical) - Contains peptides but doesn't contain the peptides that *anecdotally* have caused sagging in some people (aka it has no argireline or copper peptides). - I'm a sucker for the cute blue tub. - I love the hygienic pump type tub container. - Replacement pods are available for purchase.  Cons: - Like almost all Western beauty products, it contains phenoxyethanol, which is used as a preservative. - Depending on your budget, this product may be a bit pricey (though not any more pricey than other higher end moisturizers). - It has a very mild fermented smell which I personally don't mind, but if you're into perfumed skincare you may not be as into it.

As soon as cooler weather rolls in and heating starts sapping moisture out of the air, my skin really starts showing the signs of dehydration, while redness and irritation become a constant issue, so this moisturizer arrived just in time to save the day. It has a beautifully rich texture that goes on surprisingly lightweight and my skin absorbs it almost instantly, so I‚Äôve been able to incorporate it into both my night and morning skincare routines with no issues, it definitely doesn‚Äôt slow down the routine on those busy mornings and keeps my skin happy and comfortable all day and night. I love that it works to reinforce and repair skin barrier, but doesn‚Äôt sit heavy on the skin, so I had no issues with makeup application or staying power. The top dispenser is also one of my favorite features - so easy to get just the right amount and I don‚Äôt have to worry about contaminating the remaining product. But of course, the best part about this moisturizer is how soft, smooth and hydrated it leaves my skin, while keeping my seasonal skin issues at bay. It is also fragrance-free, so it would work well for those with sensitive skin and I am definitely keeping it in my routine from now on.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: After using the Skinfix Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream for a week, I have mixed feelings. Let me break it down:  First, the scent. To me, it reminds me of Playdoh, which is a bit odd for a skincare product. My husband, however, thinks it smells floral, so it's one of those scents that might vary depending on who's sniffing. It's not overpowering, but it‚Äôs noticeable.  As for the texture, it‚Äôs a bit tackier than I prefer in a cream. It leaves my skin feeling slightly sticky, which isn‚Äôt ideal if you're looking for something that absorbs quickly. However, I found that layering it over a hydrating serum helped mitigate the tackiness and made it more comfortable to wear.  The pump is another story. It reminds me a lot of Drunk Elephant‚Äôs packaging, which gives off a playful, almost childlike vibe. While I appreciate the hygienic nature of a pump, it can be tricky to control how much product you dispense. I‚Äôve ended up with more than I need a few times, which is frustrating since the cream is on the richer side and a little goes a long way.  Now, let‚Äôs talk about the results. I‚Äôve been using this for about a week, and while I enjoy the texture and feel of the cream, I haven‚Äôt seen the dramatic results I was expecting, especially given how much I love the Skinfix undereye cream. That product worked wonders for me, so I had high hopes for this one. I do acknowledge, though, that it might take longer than a week to see significant results.  Overall, I like the cream, but I‚Äôm not blown away just yet. I‚Äôll keep using it and see if it delivers more as time goes on, but for now, I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs quite living up to the Skinfix standard I was hoping for.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Skinfix Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream is an absolute game-changer for anyone seeking deep hydration and skin barrier repair. This luxurious, rich cream boasts a powerhouse formula designed to replenish, restore, and strengthen the skin. Its combination of triple lipid complexes, peptides, and active ingredients like hyaluronic acid delivers transformative results.  One of the standout features is how it instantly soothes dry, irritated skin. It provides an intense burst of moisture without feeling greasy or heavy, making it suitable even for sensitive skin. The blend of lipids mimics the natural components of the skin barrier, helping to lock in moisture while protecting the skin from environmental stressors.  What truly sets this cream apart is the addition of peptides. These help improve the skin's elasticity and promote collagen production, contributing to a firmer, plumper, and more youthful complexion over time. After consistent use, the cream leaves the skin looking noticeably healthier, more radiant, and smoother, with visible improvements in texture and tone.  Moreover, it's fragrance-free and dermatologist-tested, ensuring it‚Äôs safe for people with sensitive or reactive skin types. Whether used as part of a morning or nighttime routine, Skinfix Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream is the ultimate hydration savior that delivers visible results, making it a must-have for anyone serious about maintaining a healthy skin barrier.

Skinix Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream is a popular contender in the world of nourishing moisturizers, specifically designed for those with dry, sensitive, and mature skin types. This product stands out due to its robust formulation that promises to restore the skin's natural barrier, boasting a blend of active ingredients that rejuvenate and hydrate the skin deeply. The cream comes in a sleek, hygienic pump container that dispenses the right amount of product, minimizing waste and preserving the integrity of the ingredients. The packaging is user-friendly, making it easy to incorporate into both morning and evening skincare routines. At the heart of this cream's formulation are its triple lipid complex and potent peptides. Key ingredients include: Ceramides, which reinforce the skin barrier, retaining moisture, fatty acids provide essential nutrients for soft, smooth skin, peptides,which stimulate collagen production, improving skin elasticity and firmness, and, Botanical Extracts, which soothe and calm irritated skin. This combination works synergistically to provide a comprehensive approach to skin health, positioning the cream as a multifunctional powerhouse. The texture of the cream is luxuriously rich yet not overly greasy. It absorbs well into the skin, leaving it feeling plump and hydrated without a heavy residue. It smooths on effortlessly and creates an immediate sense of relief for dry skin. From the first application, the cream provides noticeable hydration and a comforting barrier against environmental aggressors. Over time, users report visibly smoother and more supple skin, with a reduction in the appearance of fine lines and improved skin texture. Its gentle formulation makes it ideal for sensitive skin, with many users noting a significant drop in irritation and redness.

reviews.review_text: As someone who has a keen interest in skincare, I was excited to try the Skinfix Barrier+ Triple Lipid Peptide Cream. This cream promises to strengthen the skin barrier, making it an appealing option for those suffering from dryness and irritation, particularly during the colder months.  Packaging: The moisturizer comes in a sleek, easy-to-use pump bottle, which is not only hygienic but also allows for precise dispensing. The minimalist design is aesthetically pleasing and fits well on any vanity.  Texture and Absorption: Upon application, the texture of the cream is rich yet surprisingly lightweight. It spreads easily across the skin and absorbs quickly without leaving a greasy residue. This is a big plus for those of us who prefer a non-oily finish, especially under makeup.  Ingredients: One of the standout features of the Skinfix Barrier+ moisturizer is its impressive ingredient list. It contains a blend of essential lipids‚Äîceramides, cholesterol, and fatty acids‚Äîthat work together to fortify the skin barrier and retain moisture. Additionally, it boasts a formulation free from fragrance and parabens, making it suitable even for sensitive skin types.  Performance: After a few weeks of consistent use, I noticed a significant improvement in the overall texture and hydration of my skin. My skin felt more supple and plump, and I experienced fewer dry patches and irritations. Even during particularly harsh weather, my complexion remained balanced and comfortable.  Scent: For those sensitive to fragrances, the Skinfix Barrier+ has a very mild, almost negligible scent, which is a plus. I appreciate products that do not overwhelm the senses, especially for leave-on skincare.  Value: While it is positioned at a mid-to-high price point, the effectiveness of the formulation justifies the investment. A little goes a long way, and given the quality of the ingredients, it feels like a worthwhile splurge for anyone serious about maintaining skin.

It leaves a bit of an oily residue for a good amount of time, so that is something to be aware of if you are wanting to wear it under makeup. I did experience a few blemishes after a week of daily use, but they were easily covered up. I will say that after just a few days of using this cream, my facial skin was smooth and well hydrated.  I really like the pump dispenser and not having to get product beneath my nails to apply it. It also keeps the product from becoming contaminated since you don't have to dig into it with your fingers.   I also appreciate that this container is refillable, keeping additional plastic out of our landfills. Overall, I would recommend this product to anyone in need of deep moisturizing on their face.  It does its job well, and the couple of complaints I have are just my own opinion and experience.  I will continue to use this product because the benefits outweigh everything else.

reviews.review_text: I can say with certainty that my skin barrier appears visibly improved, so this product delivers on its promise.  I was using this for few days before I realized that it reminded me of another more expensive product that I liked. I think this is very similar to the Kate Somerville Peptide K8 Power Cream. Unlike the K8 this is unscented, vegan and cruelty free. The packing is very similar too but the Skinfix Barrier+ is a 50ml jar while the K8 is only 30ml.  It‚Äôs also eco-friendly as you can buy refills for the container.  There is also a huge price difference, Skinfix Barrier+ is a third of the price of the K8.  Both products contain lipids, antioxidants, hyaluronic acid, and shea butter; but the Skinfix Barrier+ comes at a better value.   Overall, Skinfix Barrier+ is a winner.  It has a thick consistency that rapidly moisturizes and plumps the skin. Upon first use, I immediately noticed a difference in the smoothness of my skin.  After five days, of use my skin felt firmer and more supple. I even noticed that the fine lines around my eyes seemed less visible. This is a great moisturizer for those winter months when my skin gets super dry.   I have sensitive skin, so I use this at night after I apply my retinol cream which normally can cause me irritation.   Since using the SkinFix, I have noticed that I no longer have that irritation from my retinol.  Using this product at night has made my makeup application during the day easier and has given my skin freshness that I haven‚Äôt seen since my 20s. reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin

This cream came at a perfect time for me because here in Ohio the weather is changing and my skin gets drier than usual in the fall and winter months. Even though this cream is on the thicker side It sank into my skin and didn't leave me with greasy or oily skin.   Skinfix barrier+ Tripple Lipid-Peptide Cream is supposed to help replenish lipids + clinically proven to increase softness + radiance for healthy, nourished skin. This lovely cream is powered by a patented barrier lipid complex (B-L3) which helps refill and restore depleted lipids for smoother, more radiant, and supple skin. Nutripeptides support skin barrier health. Seaweed sodium hyaluronate deeply hydrates, and lily root extract blend helps lock hydration into the skin. Appropriate for use with retinol, AHA/BHAs, vitamin C, and more actives.   When I use Skinfix barrier+ Tripple Lipid-Peptide Cream I used at night with my retinol serum which I felt made the retinal not irritate my skin like it normally would and I'd wake up with soft, glowing skin. On nights I didn't use retinol I would use it with my glycolic acid or alone after cleansing my face. I have tried it in the AM but I prefer a light-weight cream or just an SPF, so I'm not sure how it would wear under makeup. I did feel for this cream and my SPF was too much. I love that this cream has no added fragrance, essential oils, parabens, formaldehyde, petroleum, phthalate, silicones, lanolin, propyl√®ne glycol, or pegs ni gluten. It‚Äôs vegan and cruelty-free and the component is refillable. I love the pump which dispenses the right amount and it‚Äôs more sanitary and keeps the product inside more stable.

reviews.review_title: Unfortunately did not fix my skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was very excited to try Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream by Skinfix because I've seen so many positive reviews about the product on social media and I've tried and liked their Resurface+ AHA Renewing Body Cream. On paper it sounds absolutely perfect for me and my skin type. I have combination skin and I'm a GenX'er so hydration and the minimization of fine line and wrinkles are an essential part of my skincare routine. It also works well for those who have sensitive and eczema-prone skin. I live in New England so as winter approaches I need to ramp up my moisturizer prep even more. Skinfix is a clean brand that relies on recycles packaging which is important to me. This product also offers refill packaging. I appreciate moisturizers with single-use dispensing so dirt and bacteria are not introduced into the product.  I used the cream as part of my regular skincare routine after cleanser, retinol cream, and Vitamin C serum. It was the only new product I introduced. The cream is unscented but I was not a fan of the scent. I'm always able to forgive a product for that if it works, however. The cream was also much heavier than I expected. I could feel it sitting on my face after application for much longer than I prefer. After two days of use the texture of my skin began to change, and not for the better. My skin is normally clear and 'stable' and I began to see raised bumps. By day three, I had three deep cyst-like pimples develop and it's rare for me to get even 1-2 of those per year. After day four I decided to discontinue use because a fourth deep cyst-pimple was beginning to develop and my skin did not appear to be happy with me at all. It was becoming difficult to apply makeup smoothly.  For those unsure of how their skin will react, I would definitely go slow and start off with a test patch. I still love the brand but this particular product is not for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I recently tried the Skinfix Barrier+ Triple Lipid-Peptide Cream, hoping it would provide the nourishing hydration my skin needed, but unfortunately, it didn‚Äôt work out for me. Here‚Äôs my detailed experience:  Texture & Application: The cream has a thick, rich texture, which I initially thought would be perfect for deeply moisturizing my skin. However, after applying it, I noticed that it felt quite heavy and didn‚Äôt absorb well into my skin. It left a greasy residue, which made my skin feel suffocated, almost as if my pores were being clogged. This was especially uncomfortable when I wore it during the day.  Skin Reaction: Within a day or two of using the cream, I started to notice red patches appearing on my skin, particularly on my cheeks and forehead. My skin also felt itchy and irritated. I later realized I was having an allergic reaction to one or more ingredients in the formula. This was surprising, especially since the product is dermatologist-recommended, but it goes to show that skincare is very individual.  Scent: The smell was another downside for me. It had a strange scent that I found unpleasant. While it wasn‚Äôt overpowering, it lingered on my skin for a while, which was bothersome.  Positives: Despite the negative experience, there were a few things I did like. The packaging is excellent ‚Äì it comes in a sturdy, sleek jar with a pump that dispenses the right amount of product, keeping it hygienic and easy to use. I can see how this product might work well for those with very dry skin who need a heavy-duty moisturizer, but unfortunately, it was too much for my combination-sensitive skin.
